intro: Hieracium longiscapum subsp. graciliglandulum, commonly known as the slender glandular hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, oval seeds. This subspecies is distinguished by its slender stems and the presence of glandular hairs on its leaves and stems.
